column4: I am installing 8.10 64 on an emachine with 3 gigs of ram 3200 processor and the install stops at initramfs anyone know what it wants me to do
well, does it give any error?
What do you do exactly? You put the CD inside, get the menu, select Install Ubuntu, and then it stops?
no just to type help for options
You might consider reburning that CD, it seems you did that wrong...
that is what happens
What ISO file did you use for burning the CD?
I used k3b iso 9633 I belive
No, what was the name of the ISO file?
ubuntu 8.10 64
The EXACT name of the file
for example: ubuntu-810-install.iso
ubuntu 8.10 amd64
Thats still not the name... type the file's exact name!

I am sorry, but if you are unable understanding me, I cannot help you. It's important, that you tell me the name of the ISO file you used. Maybe you have a different ISO file, than the default installer
There was an ISO file on your PC which you have used for creating the CD, right? Now you should go inside that folder, and check it's name
Good. Are you sure you have a CPU with 64 bit?
it says amd athlon 64 right on the front and it is the original processor
use "cat /proc/cpuinfo" for finding out exact CPU information
Neverthless, try to reburn that disk once again, and select the "Verify" option at the option window in K3B when burning a disk
HOW CAN i SEND YOU THE OUTPUT FROM THE TERMINAL
use http://pastebin.com
http://paste.ubuntu.com/80483/
thank you all sorry to have been trouble at first had to figure out what you wanted
